keyActions.title: Record your oxygen saturation
keyActions.description: Oxygen saturation is how much oxygen is in your blood. It is a good indicator of how well your heart and lungs are working.

keyActions.title: Record your symptoms
keyActions.description: Tell us how you've been feeling over the last week. It's important you fill this out so your care team knows how to best take care of you.

keyActions.title: Record your resting heart rate
keyActions.description: Resting heart rate is the number of times your heart beats per minute at rest. It's an easy way for your care team to gauge your recovery progress.

keyActions.title: Record your weight
keyActions.description: After surgery your body can hold on to extra fluid which causes your weight to increase. Tracking your weight lets your care team know if your body is offloading any extra fluid.
